file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 33-21-01-04 - CONTROL MODULE ASSEMBLY - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL CONTROL MODULE ASSEMBLY - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the control module assembly of the passenger cabin lights. B. The control module assembly is installed on the front left side of the passenger cabin, zone 231, on the headliner. C. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY CONTROL MODULE ASSEMBLY - RE- ALL 33-21-01-000-801-A MOVAL CONTROL MODULE ASSEMBLY - IN- ALL 33-21-01-400-801-A STALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 33-21-01 Page 1 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 33-21-01-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. CONTROL MODULE ASSEMBLY - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to remove the control module assembly. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 25-26-03-000-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-26-04-000-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-26-17-000-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-27-04-000-801-A/400 - C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Passenger cabin I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Make sure that the aircraft is safe for maintenance. (2) On the air conditioning/pneumatic control panel, installed on the overhead panel, make sure that the PASS CABIN rotary switch is not set at the ATTD position and attach a DO-NOT-SET-TO-ATTD-POSITION tag to it. (3) On the circuit breaker panel, open the EMERG circuit breaker and attach a DO-NOT- CLOSE tag to it (Location Tip: ESSENTIAL DC BUS 2/LIGHTS/EMERG). (4) (Aircraft for 37 passengers) Remove the stowage AMM TASK 25-26-03-000-801-A/400 or wardrobe AMM TASK 25-26-04-000-801-A/400 or windscreen AMM TASK 25-27-04-000-801-A/400 as applicable. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 33-21-01 Page 2 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL NOTE: For aircraft with LH galley, it is not necessary to remove the galley to remove the control module assembly. (5) (Aircraft for 16 passengers) Remove the access to the electronic equipment compartment on the LH forward stowage AMM TASK 25-26-17-000-801-A/400 J. Removal (Figure 401) (Figure 402) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) (Aircraft for 37 passengers) Remove the Control Module Assembly (5) as follows: (a) Open the latch assemblies (2). (b) Disconnect the electrical connectors (1). (c) Firmly hold the Control Module Assembly (5) and remove the screws (4) and washers (3). (2) (Aircraft for 16 passengers) Remove the Control Module Assembly (4) as follows: (a) Open the latch assemblies. (b) Disconnect the electrical connectors (1). (c) Firmly hold the Control Module Assembly (4) and remove the screws (2) and washers (3). (d) Remove the Control Module Assembly (4). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 33-21-01 Page 3 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

CONTROL MODULE ASSEMBLY DET. A 4. SCREW (4) 2. LATCH ASSEMBLY (2) 3. AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT FOR 16 PASSENGERS Control Module Assembly - Removal/Installation Figure 402 B A ZONE 231 C DET.A 1. ELECTRICAL CONNECTORS 4. LH CONTROL MODULE 3. WASHER (4) GALLEY 1. ELECTRICAL CONNECTORS 2. SCREW (4) 4. RH CONTROL MODULE DET.B 2. SCREW (4) LH WARDROBE 3. WASHER (4) DET.C 145AMM330523.MCE EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 33-21-01 Page 5 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 33-21-01-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. CONTROL MODULE ASSEMBLY - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to install the control module assembly. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 25-26-03-000-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-26-04-000-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-26-17-000-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-27-04-000-801-A/400 - CONTROL MODULE ASSEMBLY - OPERATIONAL AMM TASK 33-21-01-700-801-A/500 TEST C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Passenger cabin I. Installation (Figure 401) (Figure 402) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) (Aircraft for 37 passengers) Install the Control Module Assembly (5) as follows: (a) Firmly hold the Control Module Assembly (5) in position and install the screws (4) and washers (3). (b) Connect the electrical connectors (1). (c) Close the latch assemblies (2). (2) (Aircraft for 16 passengers) Install the Control Module Assembly (4) as follows: EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 33-21-01 Page 6 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (a) Firmly hold the Control Module Assembly (4) in position and install the screws (2) and washers (3). (b) Connect the electrical connectors (1). (c) Close the latch assemblies. J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) (Aircraft for 37 passengers) Install the stowage AMM TASK 25-26-03-000-801-A/400 or wardrobe AMM TASK 25-26-04-000-801-A/400 or windscreen AMM TASK 25-27-04-000-801-A/400 as applicable. (2) (Aircraft for 16 passengers) Install the access to the electronic equipment compartment on the LH forward stowage AMM TASK 25-26-17-000-801-A/400. (3) On the circuit breaker panel, close the EMERG circuit breaker and remove a DO-NOT- CLOSE tag from it (Location Tip: ESSENTIAL DC BUS 2/LIGHTS/EMERG). (4) On the air conditioning/pneumatic control panel, installed on the overhead panel, remove a DO-NOT-SET-TO-ATTD-POSITION tag from it. (5) Do the adjustment test of the control module assembly AMM TASK 33-21-01-700-801- A/500. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 33-21-01 Page 7 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
